greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array: For n >= 2 and 0 <= k <= n - 2, T(n, k) equals the number of rooted duplication trees on n gene segments whose leftmost visible duplication event is (k, r), for 1 <= r <= (n - k)/2.
comment: See Figure 3(a) in Gascuel et al. (2003).
reference: O. Gascuel (Ed.), Mathematics of Evolution and Phylogeny, Oxford University Press, 2005
link: O. Gascuel, M. Hendy, A. Jean-Marie and R. McLachlan, (2003) The combinatorics of tandem duplication trees, Systematic Biology 52, 110-118.
J. Yang and L. Zhang, On Counting Tandem Duplication Trees, Molecular Biology and Evolution, Volume 21, Issue 6, (2004) 1160-1163.
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j = 0.. k+1} T(n-1,j) for n >= 3, 0 <= k <= n - 2, with T(2,0) = 1 and T(n,k) = 0 for k >= n - 1.
xref: Cf. A206464 (column 0), A264868 (row sums and main diagonal), A086521.
results.author: _Peter Bala_, Nov 27 2015
